summary: "The Grapes of Wrath" is a powerful novel by John Steinbeck, published in 1939. It tells the story of the Joads, a family of struggling farmers during the Great Depression. Forced to leave their home in Oklahoma due to harsh conditions, they travel to California in search of a better life. The book won major awards and helped Steinbeck earn the Nobel Prize in Literature. It's often studied in schools because of its important historical message and has also been made into a famous movie.
title: The Grapes of Wrath
